reviewText: if you have seen this before then watch again as it is funnier the second time around. If you have not seen it then you are either a yank or you grew up in a house that was NOT as cultured as mine. Watch the video....laugh....smile....and know that life will be there when you turn off the tv. this episode is par for the course.... A plus.
Nostalgia.  Nothing like it.  Never will be again.
Apparently does not play in USA dvd players. This was not mentioned in the description on Amazon.

Admittedly this show is not for everyone, but it's influence on British sitcom history is not to be denied. The show centers on a group of four students: the mindlessly aggressive punk, Vyvyan; conman and cool guy, Mike; the narcissistic anarchist Rick; and the chronically depressed hippy, Neil. The fifth Young One is comedian Alexei Sayle, who plays the landlord and various other brilliant roles throughout the series.  Fans of AbFab and the Vicar of Dibley will recognize Jennifer Saunders and Dawn French who worked on and helped write the show. Together, the Young Ones encounter the most unlikely of scenarios such as having their landlord turn into a an ax-wielding homicidal maniac, having a vampire delivered to their house, and  being sacked by 18th century peasants. And to make the show even that much cooler, every episode features a guest performance by a different rock band: Motorhead, the Damned, Madness, etc. Love it or hate it, the Young Ones changed the face of British sitcom television forever.

I am 47 now and I started watching this on Sunday nights in college when it was on PBS. I smoked a lot of pot back then, which made it so funny it almost killed me. However I have been drug-free for 17 years now and it is still just as funny.

What can you say about The Young Ones that hasn't already been said before?? Rude, obnoxious, & irreverent humor at its absolute finest. If you require the TV shows you watch to convey a "message", this isn't the show for you. If you're looking for a stupid, non-cerebral, "laugh your @$$" experience- then this is the show for you. The musical guests are always good for a walk down memory lane, as well
Great zany classical import from the UK with wonderful comedic actors early in their careers shown on MTV. Definitely worth watching again.
unexpected and spontaneous humor in the british vein.....when you watch pay attention to the understated inserts that pop in periodically
This TV show is definitely one of my all-time favorites!  Can't go wrong with these guys.  Hilarious, takes me back!  A++

The Young Ones is a not-to-be missed blast-from-the-past. It will feel dated, but in a good 80's way. I will never think of lentils in the same way while I run around being an anarchist while living with the bomb. Enjoy, or not.

I remember watching the young ones back in the mid 80's on MTV, i thought it was the most twisted sick disgusting thing on Tv,,,and I loved it.this show is not for everyone or for the faint of heart, weak of stomach either, but if you're into off the wall comedy then you should give these guys a shot.

Back many years ago my brother turned me onto this series. I watched the episodes a couple of times and enjoyed. I finally purchased the DVD set for my brother for Xmas  and recently purchased for myself at Amazon. I have watched all episodes at least 20 times each. Like some of my favorite movies I quote lines from The Young Ones often. It was very cool to see one of my favorite bands "Motorhead" as a  musical guest (Season 2 - Ep 1..Bambi..favorite episode). Just like Seinfeld, I will watch these shows many times until I meet my Maker.
foolish and tasteless.  Okay as white noise but not as watchable tv.  I am sorry i rented it and even sorrier i wasted my time.

With episodes like `demolition', `boring' and `flood', series one introduces us to Rick, Mike, Neil and Vyv. I watch this series the first time when I was a kid, in the '80s. My brothers and cousins were big fans and fair to say I struggled to follow (as a 5-year-old). Even now some of the political wit is above my simple humour, but like the Simpsons, this is a show that has something for everyone. `Rick with a silent p' is a phrase that is now common-place in our family!
Bloody awesome.
